title: Over and Over
lyrics: Don't wait too long
I don't wanna wait 'til the moment's gone
I don't wanna play that same love song
Over and over (Yeah)
Started out good, ended up bad
You like a pop song all stuck up in my head
Finally read the lyrics, understood what they meant
When I spent all my money on my goddamn rent
Now I'm tryna figure out if it was worth it
Matter fact, I know the answer and it was no, bitch
Chilling on the island with my feet up on the beach (Hey)
But being raised on the beach couldn't prepare me for these bitches
And these sand sharks and how they try to sink they teeth in
I'm just bodysurfing, tryin' not to hit the reef
All they wanna see a brother do is sink
But I'ma ride this shit 'til my shit don't stink
I'ma sing my heart out, sing 'til I can't breathe
I'ma mean every note, even if it's off-key
Please go 'head and leave
I wouldn't wait for you, so don't wait for me
Don't wait too long
I don't wanna wait 'til the moment's gone
I don't wanna play that same love song
Over and over
If I didn't rhyme with Sony, would you still wanna bone me?
How come in the full room, I can still feel lonely?
My grandmama said watch out for them phonies
And them motherfuckers say, "Ese," just tryna be your homies
When they see you on top (Ayy)
They want a little piece of it, but they ain't gettin' nothin'
It's goin' to my nieces and my cousins
I'm havin' babies by the dozens
Pop 'em out the oven like an Egg McMuffin
Always up to nothin' (Nothin')
But, baby, you're somethin' (Somethin')
Like it when you're bumpin' down the street in your pumpkin
Wishin' it was just you and me in the moment
I'm thinkin' that it's summer
You sippin' a Corona and I'm hummin'
A song that you love and you tell me that you love it
Just then, we feel the buzz and our bodies start touchin'
Even though I know how it ends, I don't want to interrupt it (Nah)
Don't wait too long
I don't wanna wait 'til the moment's gone
I don't wanna play that same love song
Over and over
Over and over like a record that's broken
Over and over like you say that we're through
Over and over, over and over, I came back to you
And now it's over, over
Welcome to the story of my life, the miseducation of Kendrick
Stressin', Hennessy shots, throw 'em back like it's vintage
Wonderin' can I live? Where is the generosity?
Somethin' just gotta give, tryna stay positive
My motive's to be a mogul
Searchin' for a dollar without compromisin' my vocals
Really, I'm just a noble kid from the Westside of Compton
My cousins was selling crack while we played Sonic
You niggas is nonsense, I say that you full of shit
And need a colonic or maybe the Heimlich
Maneuver to throw up what you consume
My shine is bright enough to make a dead flower bloom in a room full of curtains
I'm for certain that I'm certainly poppin' the pistol verbally
And never will I get shot
Your aim is all fucked up as if your sidekick dropped
I'm nice with it, bro-bro
Over and over again, you know who I do it for
Me
Don't wait too long (Don't wait too long)
I don't wanna wait 'til the moment's gone (Don't wait too long)
I don't wanna play that same love song
Over and over
Over and over like a record that's broken
Over and over like you say that we're through
Over and over, over and over, I came back to you
And now it's over, over
